013package org.apache.juneau.http.part;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022import java.util.stream.*;
023
024import org.apache.http.*;
025import org.apache.http.util.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
030
031/**
032 * An simple list of HTTP parts (form-data, query-parameters, path-parameters).
033 *
034 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
035 * <p class='bjava'>
036 *    PartList <jv>parts</jv> = PartList
037 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
038 *       .append(MyPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>))
039 *       .append(<js>"Bar"</js>, ()-&gt;<jsm>getDynamicValueFromSomewhere</jsm>());
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <ul class='seealso'>
043 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
044 * </ul>
045 */
046@FluentSetters
047public class PartList extends ControlledArrayList<NameValuePair> {
048
049   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
050
051   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
052   // Static
053   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
054
055   /** Represents no part list in annotations. */
056   public static final class Void extends PartList {
057      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
058   }
059
060   /**
061    * Instantiates a new part list.
062    *
063    * @return A new part list.
064    */
065   public static PartList create() {
066      return new PartList();
067   }
068
069   /**
070    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified parts.
071    *
072    * @param parts
073    *    The parts to add to the list.
074    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
075    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
076    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
077    */
078   public static PartList of(List<NameValuePair> parts) {
079      return new PartList().append(parts);
080   }
081
082   /**
083    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified parts.
084    *
085    * @param parts
086    *    The parts to add to the list.
087    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
088    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
089    */
090   public static PartList of(NameValuePair...parts) {
091      return new PartList().append(parts);
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified name/value pairs.
096    *
097    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
098    * <p class='bjava'>
099    *    PartList <jv>parts</jv> = PartList.<jsm>ofPairs</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, 1, <js>"bar"</js>, <jk>true</jk>);
100    * </p>
101    *
102    * @param pairs
103    *    Initial list of pairs.
104    *    <br>Must be an even number of parameters representing key/value pairs.
105    * @throws RuntimeException If odd number of parameters were specified.
106    * @return A new instance.
107    */
108   public static PartList ofPairs(String...pairs) {
109      PartList x = new PartList();
110      if (pairs == null)
111         pairs = new String[0];
112      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
113         throw new RuntimeException("Odd number of parameters passed into PartList.ofPairs()");
114      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
115         x.add(BasicPart.of(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]));
116      return x;
117   }
118
119   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
120   // Instance
121   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
122
123   private VarResolver varResolver;
124   boolean caseInsensitive;
125
126   /**
127    * Constructor.
128    */
129   public PartList() {
130      super(false);
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Copy constructor.
135    *
136    * @param copyFrom The bean to copy.
137    */
138   protected PartList(PartList copyFrom) {
139      super(false, copyFrom);
140      caseInsensitive = copyFrom.caseInsensitive;
141   }
142
143   /**
144    * Makes a copy of this list.
145    *
146    * @return A new copy of this list.
147    */
148   public PartList copy() {
149      return new PartList(this);
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Adds a collection of default parts.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Default parts are set if they're not already in the list.
157    *
158    * @param parts The list of default parts.
159    * @return This object.
160    */
161   public PartList setDefault(List<NameValuePair> parts) {
162      if (parts != null)
163         parts.stream().filter(x -> x != null && ! contains(x.getName())).forEach(x -> set(x));
164      return this;
165   }
166
167   /**
168    * Makes a copy of this list of parts and adds a collection of default parts.
169    *
170    * <p>
171    * Default parts are set if they're not already in the list.
172    *
173    * @param parts The list of default parts.
174    * @return A new list, or the same list if the parts were empty.
175    */
176   public PartList setDefault(NameValuePair...parts) {
177      if (parts != null)
178         setDefault(Arrays.asList(parts));
179      return this;
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * Replaces the first occurrence of the part with the same name.
184    *
185    * @param name The header name.
186    * @param value The header value.
187    * @return This object.
188    */
189   public PartList setDefault(String name, Object value) {
190      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
191   }
192
193   /**
194    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
195    *
196    * @param name The header name.
197    * @param value The header value.
198    * @return This object.
199    */
200   public PartList setDefault(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
201      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
202   }
203
204
205   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
206   // Properties
207   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
208
209   /**
210    * Allows part values to contain SVL variables.
211    *
212    * <p>
213    * Resolves variables in part values when using the following methods:
214    * <ul>
215    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
216    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
217    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
218    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
219    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
220    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
221    * </ul>
222    *
223    * <p>
224    * Uses {@link VarResolver#DEFAULT} to resolve variables.
225    *
226    * @return This object.
227    */
228   public PartList resolving() {
229      return resolving(VarResolver.DEFAULT);
230   }
231
232   /**
233    * Allows part values to contain SVL variables.
234    *
235    * <p>
236    * Resolves variables in part values when using the following methods:
237    * <ul>
238    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
239    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
240    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
241    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
242    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
243    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
244    * </ul>
245    *
246    * @param varResolver The variable resolver to use for resolving variables.
247    * @return This object.
248    */
249   public PartList resolving(VarResolver varResolver) {
250      assertModifiable();
251      this.varResolver = varResolver;
252      return this;
253   }
254
255   /**
256    * Specifies that the parts in this list should be treated as case-sensitive.
257    *
258    * <p>
259    * The default behavior is case-sensitive.
260    *
261    * @param value The new value for this setting.
262    * @return This object.
263    */
264   public PartList caseInsensitive(boolean value) {
265      assertModifiable();
266      caseInsensitive = value;
267      return this;
268   }
269
270   /**
271    * Adds the specified part to the end of the parts in this list.
272    *
273    * @param value The part to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
274    * @return This object.
275    */
276   @FluentSetter
277   public PartList append(NameValuePair value) {
278      if (value != null)
279         add(value);
280      return this;
281   }
282
283   /**
284    * Appends the specified part to the end of this list.
285    *
286    * <p>
287    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
288    *
289    * @param name The part name.
290    * @param value The part value.
291    * @return This object.
292    */
293   public PartList append(String name, Object value) {
294      return append(createPart(name, value));
295   }
296
297   /**
298    * Appends the specified part to the end of this list using a value supplier.
299    *
300    * <p>
301    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
302    *
303    * <p>
304    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicPart#getValue()}.
305    *
306    * @param name The part name.
307    * @param value The part value supplier.
308    * @return This object.
309    */
310   public PartList append(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
311      return append(createPart(name, value));
312   }
313
314   /**
315    * Adds the specified parts to the end of the parts in this list.
316    *
317    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
318    * @return This object.
319    */
320   @FluentSetter
321   public PartList append(NameValuePair...values) {
322      if (values != null)
323         for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
324            append(values[i]);
325      return this;
326   }
327
328   /**
329    * Adds the specified parts to the end of the parts in this list.
330    *
331    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
332    * @return This object.
333    */
334   @FluentSetter
335   public PartList append(List<NameValuePair> values) {
336      if (values != null)
337         values.forEach(x -> append(x));
338      return this;
339   }
340
341   /**
342    * Adds the specified part to the beginning of the parts in this list.
343    *
344    * @param value The part to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
345    * @return This object.
346    */
347   @FluentSetter
348   public PartList prepend(NameValuePair value) {
349      if (value != null)
350         add(0, value);
351      return this;
352   }
353
354   /**
355    * Appends the specified part to the beginning of this list.
356    *
357    * <p>
358    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
359    *
360    * @param name The part name.
361    * @param value The part value.
362    * @return This object.
363    */
364   public PartList prepend(String name, Object value) {
365      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
366   }
367
368   /**
369    * Appends the specified part to the beginning of this list using a value supplier.
370    *
371    * <p>
372    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
373    *
374    * <p>
375    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicPart#getValue()}.
376    *
377    * @param name The part name.
378    * @param value The part value supplier.
379    * @return This object.
380    */
381   public PartList prepend(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
382      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
383   }
384
385   /**
386    * Adds the specified parts to the beginning of the parts in this list.
387    *
388    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
389    * @return This object.
390    */
391   @FluentSetter
392   public PartList prepend(NameValuePair...values) {
393      if (values != null)
394         prepend(alist(values));
395      return this;
396   }
397
398   /**
399    * Adds the specified parts to the beginning of the parts in this list.
400    *
401    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
402    * @return This object.
403    */
404   @FluentSetter
405   public PartList prepend(List<NameValuePair> values) {
406      if (values != null)
407         addAll(0, values);
408      return this;
409   }
410
411   /**
412    * Removes the specified part from this list.
413    *
414    * @param value The part to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
415    * @return This object.
416    */
417   @FluentSetter
418   public PartList remove(NameValuePair value) {
419      if (value != null)
420         removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), value.getName()) && eq(x.getValue(), value.getValue()));
421      return this;
422   }
423
424   /**
425    * Removes the specified parts from this list.
426    *
427    * @param values The parts to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
428    * @return This object.
429    */
430   @FluentSetter
431   public PartList remove(NameValuePair...values) {
432      for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
433         remove(values[i]);
434      return this;
435   }
436
437   /**
438    * Removes the specified parts from this list.
439    *
440    * @param values The parts to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
441    * @return This object.
442    */
443   @FluentSetter
444   public PartList remove(List<NameValuePair> values) {
445      if (values != null)
446         values.forEach(x -> remove(x));
447      return this;
448   }
449
450   /**
451    * Removes the part with the specified name from this list.
452    *
453    * @param name The part name.
454    * @return This object.
455    */
456   @FluentSetter
457   public PartList remove(String name) {
458      removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
459      return this;
460   }
461
462   /**
463    * Removes the part with the specified name from this list.
464    *
465    * @param names The part name.
466    * @return This object.
467    */
468   @FluentSetter
469   public PartList remove(String...names) {
470      if (names != null)
471         for (int i = 0; i < names.length; i++)
472            remove(names[i]);
473      return this;
474   }
475
476   /**
477    * Adds or replaces the part(s) with the same name.
478    *
479    * <p>
480    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
481    *
482    * @param value The part to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
483    * @return This object.
484    */
485   @FluentSetter
486   public PartList set(NameValuePair value) {
487      if (value != null) {
488         boolean replaced = false;
489         for (int i = 0, j = size(); i < j; i++) {
490            NameValuePair x = get(i);
491            if (eq(x.getName(), value.getName())) {
492               if (replaced) {
493                  remove(i);
494                  j--;
495               } else {
496                  set(i, value);
497                  replaced = true;
498               }
499            }
500         }
501
502         if (! replaced)
503            add(value);
504      }
505
506      return this;
507   }
508
509   /**
510    * Adds or replaces the part(s) with the same name.
511    *
512    * <p>
513    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
514    *
515    * @param values The part to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
516    * @return This object.
517    */
518   @FluentSetter
519   public PartList set(NameValuePair...values) {
520      if (values != null)
521         set(alist(values));
522      return this;
523   }
524
525   /**
526    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
527    *
528    * @param name The part name.
529    * @param value The part value.
530    * @return This object.
531    */
532   public PartList set(String name, Object value) {
533      return set(createPart(name, value));
534   }
535
536   /**
537    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
538    *
539    * @param name The part name.
540    * @param value The part value.
541    * @return This object.
542    */
543   public PartList set(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
544      return set(createPart(name, value));
545   }
546
547   /**
548    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
549    *
550    * <p>
551    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
552    *
553    * @param values The parts to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
554    * @return This object.
555    */
556   @FluentSetter
557   public PartList set(List<NameValuePair> values) {
558
559      if (values != null) {
560         for (int i1 = 0, j1 = values.size(); i1 < j1; i1++) {
561            NameValuePair h = values.get(i1);
562            if (h != null) {
563               for (int i2 = 0, j2 = size(); i2 < j2; i2++) {
564                  NameValuePair x = get(i2);
565                  if (eq(x.getName(), h.getName())) {
566                     remove(i2);
567                     j2--;
568                  }
569               }
570            }
571         }
572
573         for (int i = 0, j = values.size(); i < j; i++) {
574            NameValuePair x = values.get(i);
575            if (x != null) {
576               add(x);
577            }
578         }
579      }
580
581      return this;
582   }
583
584   /**
585    * Gets the first part with the given name.
586    *
587    * <p>
588    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
589    *
590    * @param name The part name.
591    * @return The first matching part, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
592    */
593   public Optional<NameValuePair> getFirst(String name) {
594      for (int i = 0; i < size(); i++) {
595         NameValuePair x = get(i);
596         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
597            return optional(x);
598      }
599      return empty();
600   }
601
602   /**
603    * Gets the last part with the given name.
604    *
605    * <p>
606    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
607    *
608    * @param name The part name.
609    * @return The last matching part, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
610    */
611   public Optional<NameValuePair> getLast(String name) {
612      for (int i = size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
613         NameValuePair x = get(i);
614         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
615            return optional(x);
616      }
617      return empty();
618   }
619
620   /**
621    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
622    *
623    * <p>
624    * If more that one part with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
625    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
626    *
627    * @param name The part name.
628    * @return A part with a condensed value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if no parts by the given name are present
629    */
630   public Optional<NameValuePair> get(String name) {
631
632      NameValuePair first = null;
633      List<NameValuePair> rest = null;
634      for (NameValuePair x : this) {
635         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
636            if (first == null)
637               first = x;
638            else {
639               if (rest == null)
640                  rest = list();
641               rest.add(x);
642            }
643         }
644      }
645
646      if (first == null)
647         return empty();
648
649      if (rest == null)
650         return optional(first);
651
652      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
653      sb.append(first.getValue());
654      for (int i = 0; i < rest.size(); i++) {
655         sb.append(',');
656         sb.append(rest.get(i).getValue());
657      }
658
659      return optional(new BasicStringPart(name, sb.toString()));
660   }
661
662   /**
663    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
664    *
665    * <p>
666    * If more that one part with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
667    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
668    *
669    * <p>
670    * The implementation class must have a public constructor taking in one of the following argument lists:
671    * <ul>
672    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
673    *    <li><c>X(Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
674    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
675    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
676    * </ul>
677    *
678    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
679    * <p class='bjava'>
680    *    BasicIntegerPart <jv>age</jv> = <jv>partList</jv>.get(<js>"age"</js>, BasicIntegerPart.<jk>class</jk>);
681    * </p>
682    *
683    * @param <T> The part implementation class.
684    * @param name The part name.
685    * @param type The part implementation class.
686    * @return A part with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no parts by the given name are present
687    */
688   public <T> Optional<T> get(String name, Class<T> type) {
689
690      NameValuePair first = null;
691      List<NameValuePair> rest = null;
692      for (NameValuePair x : this) {
693         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
694            if (first == null)
695               first = x;
696            else {
697               if (rest == null)
698                  rest = list();
699               rest.add(x);
700            }
701         }
702      }
703
704      if (first == null)
705         return empty();
706
707      if (rest == null)
708         return optional(PartBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, first.getValue()));
709
710      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
711      sb.append(first.getValue());
712      for (int i = 0; i < rest.size(); i++) {
713         sb.append(',');
714         sb.append(rest.get(i).getValue());
715      }
716
717      return optional(PartBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, sb.toString()));
718   }
719
720   /**
721    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
722    *
723    * <p>
724    * Same as {@link #get(String, Class)} but the part name is pulled from the name or value attribute of the {@link FormData}/{@link Query}/{@link Path} annotation.
725    *
726    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
727    * <p class='bjava'>
728    *    Age <jv>age</jv> = <jv>partList</jv>.get(Age.<jk>class</jk>);
729    * </p>
730    *
731    * @param <T> The part implementation class.
732    * @param type The part implementation class.
733    * @return A part with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no parts by the given name are present
734    */
735   public <T> Optional<T> get(Class<T> type) {
736      assertArgNotNull("type", type);
737
738      String name = PartBeanMeta.of(type).getSchema().getName();
739      assertArg(name != null, "Part name could not be found on bean type ''{0}''", type.getName());
740
741      return get(name, type);
742   }
743
744   /**
745    * Gets all of the parts.
746    *
747    * <p>
748    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the parts were added.
749    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
750    *
751    * <p>
752    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
753    * get parts.
754    *
755    * @return An array containing all parts, never <jk>null</jk>.
756    */
757   public NameValuePair[] getAll() {
758      return stream().toArray(NameValuePair[]::new);
759   }
760
761   /**
762    * Gets all of the parts with the given name.
763    *
764    * <p>
765    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the parts were added.
766    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
767    * Parts with null values are ignored.
768    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
769    *
770    * <p>
771    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
772    * get parts.
773    *
774    * @param name The part name.
775    *
776    * @return An array containing all matching parts, never <jk>null</jk>.
777    */
778   public NameValuePair[] getAll(String name) {
779      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).toArray(NameValuePair[]::new);
780   }
781
782   /**
783    * Performs an action on the values for all matching parts in this list.
784    *
785    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
786    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
787    * @return This object.
788    */
789   public PartList forEachValue(Predicate<NameValuePair> filter, Consumer<String> action) {
790      return forEach(filter, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
791   }
792
793   /**
794    * Performs an action on the values of all matching parts in this list.
795    *
796    * @param name The part name.
797    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
798    * @return This object.
799    */
800   public PartList forEachValue(String name, Consumer<String> action) {
801      return forEach(name, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
802   }
803
804   /**
805    * Returns all the string values for all parts with the specified name.
806    *
807    * @param name The part name.
808    * @return An array containing all values.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
809    */
810   public String[] getValues(String name) {
811      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).map(x -> x.getValue()).toArray(String[]::new);
812   }
813
814   /**
815    * Tests if parts with the given name are contained within this list.
816    *
817    * <p>
818    * Part name comparison is case insensitive.
819    *
820    * @param name The part name.
821    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one part with the name is present.
822    */
823   public boolean contains(String name) {
824      return stream().anyMatch(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
825   }
826
827   /**
828    * Returns an iterator over this list of parts.
829    *
830    * @return A new iterator over this list of parts.
831    */
832   public PartIterator partIterator() {
833      return new BasicPartIterator(toArray(new NameValuePair[0]), null, caseInsensitive);
834   }
835
836   /**
837    * Returns an iterator over the parts with a given name in this list.
838    *
839    * @param name The name of the parts over which to iterate, or <jk>null</jk> for all parts
840    *
841    * @return A new iterator over the matching parts in this list.
842    */
843   public PartIterator partIterator(String name) {
844      return new BasicPartIterator(getAll(name), name, caseInsensitive);
845   }
846
847   /**
848    * Performs an action on all parts in this list with the specified name.
849    *
850    * <p>
851    * This is the preferred method for iterating over parts as it does not involve
852    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
853    *
854    * @param name The parts name.
855    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
856    * @return This object.
857    */
858   public PartList forEach(String name, Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
859      return forEach(x -> eq(name, x.getName()), action);
860   }
861
862   /**
863    * Performs an action on all the matching parts in this list.
864    *
865    * <p>
866    * This is the preferred method for iterating over parts as it does not involve
867    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
868    *
869    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
870    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
871    * @return This object.
872    */
873   public PartList forEach(Predicate<NameValuePair> filter, Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
874      forEach(x -> consume(filter, action, x));
875      return this;
876   }
877
878   /**
879    * Returns a stream of the parts in this list with the specified name.
880    *
881    * <p>
882    * This does not involve a copy of the underlying array of <c>NameValuePair</c> objects so should perform well.
883    *
884    * @param name The part name.
885    * @return This object.
886    */
887   public Stream<NameValuePair> stream(String name) {
888      return stream().filter(x->eq(name, x.getName()));
889   }
890
891   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
892   // Other methods
893   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
894
895   private NameValuePair createPart(String name, Object value) {
896      boolean isResolving = varResolver != null;
897
898      if (value instanceof Supplier<?>) {
899         Supplier<?> value2 = (Supplier<?>)value;
900         return isResolving ? new BasicPart(name, resolver(value2)) : new BasicPart(name, value2);
901      }
902      return isResolving ? new BasicPart(name, resolver(value)) : new BasicPart(name, value);
903   }
904
905   private Supplier<Object> resolver(Object input) {
906      return ()->varResolver.resolve(stringify(unwrap(input)));
907   }
908
909   private Object unwrap(Object o) {
910      while (o instanceof Supplier)
911         o = ((Supplier<?>)o).get();
912      return o;
913   }
914
915   private boolean eq(String s1, String s2) {
916      return caseInsensitive ? StringUtils.eqic(s1, s2) : StringUtils.eq(s1, s2);
917   }
918
919   /**
920    * Returns this list as a URL-encoded custom query.
921    */
922   @Override /* Object */
923   public String toString() {
924      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
925      forEach(p -> {
926         if (p != null) {
927            String v = p.getValue();
928            if (v != null) {
929               if (sb.length() > 0)
930                  sb.append("&");
931               sb.append(urlEncode(p.getName())).append('=').append(urlEncode(p.getValue()));
932            }
933         }
934      });
935      return sb.toString();
936   }

942      super.setUnmodifiable();
943      return this;
944   }
